intro: Elekmania buchii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Elekmania buchii prefers well-drained soil and partial shade, making it a popular ornamental plant in gardens and indoor settings. Its flowers, which range in color from white to purple, bloom throughout the year in suitable conditions.
